sourceComments:
[It's pretty late already] and [my room] was not put in order -> is still a mess...

katadzuku: to be put in order, to be put to rights; to be finished
Quick reminder: Japanese has transitive and intransitive verbs. The transitive ones are actively executed by someone while the intransitive ones "happen". Do you remember katadzukeru? It is the transitive one. Don't worry too much about this, maybe have a quick look at Tae Kim's explanation.
reading: そして かたづかない
